resources.string: This method is not recommended when mirroring to wireless displays
NOTE: Some custom kernels may prevent the backlight from turning off completely with the Backlight Off option.
NOTE: On Samsung devices, the backlight may not turn off completely with the Backlight Off option.
To protect your device, SecondScreen will not allow you to save this profile with the selected resolution and density.
Please uninstall this version of SecondScreen and use the previously installed version instead.
Cannot delete the currently active profile

SecondScreen: optimize your Android for the big screen

© 2014 Braden Farmer

This app uses code from the following open source projects, licensed under Apache 2.0:

• Android Action Bar Style Generator

• Connect your display first, if you have not already done so.

• Make sure you've granted root access to SecondScreen - otherwise, it won't do anything.

• Hang tight for a few seconds as your device changes its resolution and density!

• When the SecondScreen icon appears in the status bar, your device is ready to use.

• For best results, connect any Bluetooth devices after the profile is finished loading.

• When you're finished using your display, select the Turn Off option in the notification.
is currently active. Would you like to turn it off?
SecondScreen has not been tested on this version of Android. It may crash or behave in other unexpected ways.
This is the currently active profile. Would you like to reload it to apply your changes?

Expert mode overrides SecondScreen\'s internal blacklist of unsafe resolution and density combinations. Only use this option if you know exactly what you are doing. Safe mode is strongly recommended when using this option.\n\nReally enable expert mode?
Allow any user-defined value to be set for resolution and DPI

This app REQUIRES root access to operate and is ONLY for devices with AOSP or stock (Google) Android ROMs! It is not guaranteed to function properly on devices with manufacturer-skinned ROMs.\n\nYou are SOLELY held responsible for how you use this app, for the type of device you use it on, and for the methods of obtaining root access on your device.
Start SecondScreen when connecting a display

SecondScreen appears to have been restored from a backup.\n\nIf this is a different device, please clear app data and re-run SecondScreen to ensure that it operates correctly (otherwise, problems may occur).
Profiles will not stay active after a reboot
Tap a profile name to view or load its settings.\nCreate additional profiles using the plus button.
The highlighted profile below is currently active.\nTap its name to view its settings or turn it off.
Use Quick Actions to access SecondScreen functionality without creating a new profile, or temporarily modify an existing running profile without editing it.
Profile not found!\n\nPlease recreate or delete this shortcut.
Reload the currently active profile to apply changed settings?
Create your first profile by tapping the New Profile button (plus sign) at the top
